alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CHOCTAW... NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...WAYNE AND NORTHERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Gilbertown to 3 miles southeast of Silas to Waynesboro to 7 miles south of Stafford Springs. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Clara, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, and Fruitdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
